Experience with sales principles and practices, including business development, marketing, and complex channel management.

You will be applying your deep understanding of NLP and ML, rigor with respect to data, and a knack for building great software that delivers jaw-dropping value. Our clients include some of the world’s largest corporations, financial institutions, and government agencies. You can learn more about Primer's technology and the sort of problems we solve at our blog, as well as recent media coverage of our work.

In return, we have the privilege of backing you with thousands of technical experts in diverse fields, a culture of innovation and knowledge sharing, access to data and resources uniquely available to MITRE through our wide-ranging partnerships across government, industry and academia.

As a member of MITRE’s IdAM Capability Area, provide guidance and expertise to multiple government sponsors to specify and implement Identity and Access Management (IdAM) solutions for widely varied architectures. Solutions work may include: strategies, capabilities, reference architectures, and recommended solutions. Solutions will involve use of Attribute Based Access Control (ABAC), Role Based Access Control (RBAC), and multiple types of identification and authentication technologies (e.g., PKI, tokens), including for mobile devices. Role may also involve research and development activities with any IdAM related technologies. This role may require some on-site support at sponsor locations.

Key Functions:
  • Development of approaches to address implementations of Identity and Access Management (IdAM) solutions as part of Enterprise security services.
  • Interfacing with government personnel and working groups to solve specific challenges, adapting legacy systems to new technology, and creating reference and future architectures.
This role offers opportunities for contributing to and providing guidance and technical expertise on widely varying activities:
  • Design, implementation, and deployment of functional, resilient, and secure IdAM solutions
  • Addressing challenges associated with access control solutions
  • In depth surveys and analysis of current and future IdAM and access control technologies
  • Analytic collection of IdAM and access control requirements across enterprise organizations
  • Working with data and user attributes to enable policy enforcement
  • Investigating digital authorization policy management approaches

Minimum Qualifications:
  • BS and 8 years of related experience

  • Knowledge of current Cybersecurity technologies and practices and their relationship to IdAM

  • Strong understanding of IdAM in Windows environments
  • Some familiarity of iOS and Android ecosystems to support the credentialing of mobile devices.
  • Secret level security clearance
